title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Renewable
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Renewable 

Energy)(Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (renewable energy)(amendment) regulation 2025 interpretation

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Principal Regulations” means the European Union (Renewable Energy) 
Regulations (2) 2022 (S.I. No. 350 of 2022); 

“Regulations of 2012” means the European Union (Biofuel Sustainability 
Criteria) Regulations of 2012 (S.I. No. 33 of 2012). 

Amendments to the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - principal regulation mean european union (renewable energy) regulation (2) 2022 (s.i no 350 2022) regulation 2012 mean european union (biofuel sustainability criteria) regulation 2012 (s.i no 33 2012) amendment principal regulation

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph (1),
text_raw:
3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph (1), 
by the substitution of the following definition for the definition of ‘final 
customer’: 

“‘final customer’ means a customer who purchases electricity or gas for own 
use;”
text_norm: 3 regulation 2 principal regulation amended paragraph (1) substitution following definition definition final customer final customer mean customer purchase electricity gas use

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 4. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after
text_raw:
4. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after 

paragraph (5) the following paragraph: 

“(6) The obligations in this Regulation shall apply regardless of whether the 
bioliquids are produced within the State or are imported.”
text_norm: 4 regulation 9 principal regulation amended inserting paragraph (5) following paragraph (6) obligation regulation shall apply regardless whether bioliquids produced within state imported

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 5. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after
text_raw:
5. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting after 

paragraph (5) the following paragraph: 

“(6) The obligations in this Regulation shall apply regardless of whether the 
biomass fuels are produced within the State or are imported.” 

1 OJ No. L312, 22.11.2008, p.3. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st April, 2025.

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 6. The Principal Regulations are amended by inserting after Regulation 25
text_raw:
6. The Principal Regulations are amended by inserting after Regulation 25 

the following Regulation: 

“Competent bodies 

25A. Competent bodies designated under these Regulations to design, 
establish and publish a supervisory framework for the issuance, transfer and 
cancellation of guarantees of origin for the purposes of compliance with Article 
19 of the Directive, shall not have overlapping geographical responsibilities, and 
shall be independent of production, trade and supply activities.”
text_norm: 6 principal regulation amended inserting regulation 25 following regulation competent body 25a competent body designated regulation design establish publish supervisory framework issuance transfer cancellation guarantee origin purpose compliance article 19 directive shall overlapping geographical responsibility shall independent production trade supply activity

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 7. Regulation 26 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
7. Regulation 26 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

by inserting after paragraph (1) the following sub-paragraph: 

“(a) A transfer of a guarantee of origin for electricity or for gas 
shall have no function in relation to the decision to use statistical 
transfers, joint projects or joint support schemes as defined under 
the Directive, for the purpose of compliance with Article 3 of the 
Directive or on the calculation of energy from renewable sources 
in accordance with Regulation 3.” 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (5) the following paragraph: 

For the purposes of Article 19(8) of the Directive, a gas 
“(6) 
supplier or electricity supplier shall use for disclosure the same 
type of guarantees of origin as the energy supplied.”
text_norm: 7 regulation 26 principal regulation amended - (a) inserting paragraph (1) following sub-paragraph (a) transfer guarantee origin electricity gas shall function relation decision use statistical transfer joint project joint support scheme defined directive purpose compliance article 3 directive calculation energy renewable source accordance regulation 3 (b) inserting paragraph (5) following paragraph purpose article 19(8) directive gas (6) supplier electricity supplier shall use disclosure type guarantee origin energy supplied

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 8. Regulation 27 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
8. Regulation 27 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

by substituting for paragraph (5) the following paragraphs: 

“(5) When a producer receives financial support from a 
support scheme for gas, the market value of the guarantee of 
origin for gas for a renewable energy unit for the same production 
shall be taken into account appropriately in the relevant support 
scheme applicable to that renewable energy unit. It shall be 
presumed that the market value of the guarantee of origin has 
been taken into account appropriately in any of the following 
cases: 

(a) where the financial support is granted by way of a 
tendering procedure or a tradeable green certificate 
system; 

(b) where the market value of the guarantee of origin is 
administratively taken into account in the level of 
financial support; or 

(c) where the guarantees of origin are not issued directly to 
the producer but to a supplier or consumer who buys the 
energy from renewable sources either in a competitive 
setting or in a long-term renewables power purchase 
agreement”. 

 
 
 4 [97] 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (5) the following paragraph: 

“(5A) The supervisory framework for guarantees of origin for 
renewable gas may provide for the issue and immediate 
cancellation of a guarantee of origin for the purposes of taking 
into account its market value.” 

(c) 

by substituting for paragraph (6) the following paragraph: 

For the purposes of paragraph (4) of Regulation 26, 
“(6) 
guarantees of origin for electricity or for gas shall be valid for 12 
months after the production of the relevant renewable energy 
unit.” 

(d) by inserting after paragraph (10) the following sub-paragraph: 

“(a) 
For the purposes of disclosure referred to in Article 19(8) 
and 19(13) of the Directive, GNI, acting in accordance with the 
framework referred to in paragraph (1) of Regulation 25, shall 
ensure that energy companies cancel guarantees of origin for gas 
at the latest six months after the end of the validity of the 
guarantee of origin for gas.” 

(e) 

in paragraph (12) by substituting for sub-paragraph (a) the 
following sub-paragraph: 

that the guarantee of origin for electricity or for gas relates 

“(a) 
to electricity or gas from renewable sources,” 

(f) 

in paragraph (12) by substituting for sub-paragraph (c) the 
following sub-paragraph: 

the identity, location, type and capacity of the installation 

“(c) 
where the electricity or gas was produced,”

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 9. Regulation 28 of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting
text_raw:
9. Regulation 28 of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting 

for the title of Regulation 28 the following: 

“Request for issue of guarantee of origin from electricity or gas and information 
required”. 

Amendment to the Regulations of 2012
text_norm: 9 regulation 28 principal regulation amended substituting title regulation 28 following request issue guarantee origin electricity gas information required  amendment regulation 2012

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 10. Regulation 6 of the Regulations of 2012 is amended by inserting after
text_raw:
10. Regulation 6 of the Regulations of 2012 is amended by inserting after 

paragraph (5) the following paragraph: 

“(6) The obligations in this Regulation shall apply regardless of whether the 
consignment of renewable transport fuel is produced in the State or is imported.”
